abstract.text: A multiple center clinical evaluation of an ultra-fast single-tube assay for SARS-CoV-2 RNA, Clinical Microbiology and Infection, https://doi.Abstract 41 Objectives: To evaluate the performance of an ultra-fast single-tube 42 nucleic acid isothermal amplification detection assay for SARS-CoV-2 43 RNA using clinical samples from multiple centers. 44 Methods: A reverse transcription recombinase-aided amplification 45 (RT-RAA) assay for SARS-CoV-2 was conducted within 15minutesat39 46 with portable instruments after addition of extracted RNA. The clinical 47 Conclusion: With comparable sensitivity and specificity to the 62 commercial qRT-PCR kits, RT-RAA assay for SARS-CoV-2 exhibited 63 distinctive advantages of simplicity and rapidity in terms of operation 64 and turn-around time. 65

body_text.text: Hubei CDC. The specimens that can be processed within 24 hours were 127 stored at 4 , and those that cannot were stored at ℃ -70 or below. All ℃ 128 aspects of the study were performed in accordance with national ethics 129 regulations and approved by the Institutional Review Boards of local 130

We downloaded the whole SARS-CoV-2genome sequences available 134 from the Global Initiative on Sharing All Influenza Data (GISAID). We the target gene to screen the best set of primers and probes, the 142 recombinant plasmid was diluted to 10 5 , 10 4 , 10 3 , 10 2 , 10 1 , 2 and 1 143 copies/test, and non-ribozyme water was used as a negative control. We 144 then used the specificity evaluation panel to further explore the 145 specificity of RT-RAA kit for SARS-CoV-2, and finally two primers and 146 one probe with the highest amplification efficiency were chosen. 147
According to the instructions recommended by the manufacturer, the 149 total RNA was extracted from 200 µL of sample preservation solution 150
using Tian Long automatic extraction kit (Tian Long, Soochow, China). 151
The nucleic acid was eluted in 50 µL of nuclease free water and stored at 152 -80 °C until use.
We freeze-dried the selected primers and probe to the reaction unit 155 tube, and made a single-tube SARS-CoV-2 nucleic acid isothermal 156 amplification rapid detection kit (RT-RAA kit).

body_text.section: Sensitivity and specificity of the RT-RAA kit 203

body_text.text: Totally, 947 samples were detected by RT-RAA and qRT-PCR (Table 2 ) 221 (Supplementary Table S2 100 (4/4) 100 (4/4) stool 0 (0/2) 0 (0/2) whole blood 0 (0/1) 0 (0/1) Table 3 Positive rates of RT-RAA and qRT-PCR in different sample types. cross-contamination while has lower cost than that of qRT-PCR kits. 295

The proposed RT-RAA kit had a sensitivity of 2 copies per reaction 296 using DNA template, which might not reflect the true sensitivity using 297 In conclusion, our results strongly demonstrate RT-RAA kit for 319

SARS-CoV-2 shows comparable sensitivity and specificity to the 320 commercial qRT-PCR kits, and exhibits distinctive advantages of 321 simplicity and rapidity over qRT-PCR kits in terms of operation and 322 turn-around time. This RT-RAA kit is therefore a promising tool to be 323 potentially used in the resource-limited scenes or remote areas such as 324 community fever clinics and mobile laboratories. 325

FIGREF0.text: These first authors contributed equally to this article. 27 *These senior authors contributed equally to this article. 28 *Corresponding authors: Dr.Yongzhong Jiang, Hubei Center for Disease 29 Control and Prevention, No. 6, Zhuodaoquan north road, Hongshan 30 district, Wuhan 430000, China; Email: 575652423@qq.com;Dr.Wenbo 31 Xu, National Institute for Viral Disease Control and Prevention, Chinese 32 Center for Disease Control and Prevention, No. 155, Changbai Street, 33 Changping District, Beijing 102206, China; Email: 34 wenbo_xu1@aliyun.com; Dr. Xuejun Ma, NHC Key Laboratory of 35 Medical Virology and Viral Diseases, National Institute for Viral Disease 36 Control and Prevention, Chinese Center for Disease Control and 37 Prevention, No. 155, Changbai Street, Changping District, Beijing 38 performance of RT-RAA assay was evaluated using 947 clinical samples 48 from five institutions in four regions of China, and the approved 49 commercial real-time fluorescent RT-PCR (qRT-PCR) kits were used for 50 parallel detection. The sensitivity and specificity of RT-RAA were 51 compared and analyzed. 52 Results: The RT-RAA test results of 926 samples were consistent with 53 those of qRT-PCR (330 were positive, 596 were negative) and 21 were 54

FIGREF1.text: 102 Recently, we developed a single-tube reverse transcription 103 recombinase-aided amplification (RT-RAA) assay for SARS-CoV-2. 104 This RT-RAA kit was first launched on Jan. 29, 2020, and passed the 105 external quality assessment of National Institute for Viral Disease 106 Control and Prevention (IVDC), Chinese Center for disease control and 107 prevention (CCDC) and Beijing CDC. In the present study, we report a 108 multicenter clinical evaluation of this RT-RAA kit using a large number of clinical samples involved in five institutions in four regions, China. 110 Materials and methods 111 Specimens 112 The specificity evaluation panel was provided by National Institute 113 for Viral Disease Control and Prevention (IVDC), Chinese Center for 114 Disease Control and Prevention (CCDC). This panel consisted of 115 inactivated culture of SARS-CoV-2, human coronavirus (CoV-229E, 116 OC43, HKU1, NL63), human rhinovirus (HRV), Boca virus (HBoV), 117 parainfluenza virus (PIV), respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), human 118 metapneumovirus (HMPV), Influenza A virus, and chlamydia 119 pneumonia (CP), streptococcus pneumoniae (SP) and Klebsiella 120 pneumoniae (KPN). We obtained clinical samples from consecutive 121 patients in five institutions from four regions in China (Hubei, Jiangsu, 122 Zhejiang, Shanxi Province) for multicenter clinical evaluation. These 123 samples were divided into four groups (A-D). Group A: Jiangsu CDC， 124 Group B: Zhejiang CDC, Group C: Datong CDC, Shanxi Province, and 125 the Fifth People's Hospital of Datong City, Shanxi Province, Group D: 126

FIGREF2.text: 135 then selected the conserved region of ORF1ab gene of SARS-CoV-2 as 136 the target. The corresponding primers and probes were designed using 137 Oligo7 according to the principles required by RAA. A total of 46 pairs 138 of primers and 2 probes candidates were synthesized by Sangon Biotech 139 (Shanghai, China). A preliminary evaluation of the RT-RAA specificity 140 was conducted in Silicon. We used the recombinant plasmid containing 141

FIGREF3.text: A reaction system of 50 157 µL was set up. The system included one reaction unit tube containing 158 lyophilized primer/probes and enzymes, 42.5 µL of reaction buffer, 2.5 159 µL of 280 mM magnesium acetate, 5 µL of extracted nucleic acid or 5 160 µL negative / positive control. A 42.5 µL buffer was added to each 161 reaction unit tube with a pipette, and 2.5 µL magnesium acetate solution 162 was added to the inside of the reaction tube cover. After that, the sample 163 or negative and positive control was added. After capping the tube, the 164 reaction tube was symmetrically placed in RAA-B6108 for mix and 165 centrifugation for 7minutes, the reaction tube was then removed and 166 transferred to the nucleic acid amplification fluorescence detector 167 RAA-F1620. The reaction temperature was set at 39 for 10 minutes, 168 and the time of each sample to reach the threshold could be measured in 169 real time by the fluorescence signal detector. 170 Reference qRT-PCR kits for SARS-CoV-2 detection 171 The Technical Guide for Laboratory testing of COVID-19 (third 172 Edition) recommended that the confirmed case of COVID-19 infection 173 should be identified by qRT-PCR kits. So far, about 19qRT-PCR kits 174 were officially approved by National Medical Products Administration The reference qRT-PCR kits in this study were 2019-nCoV Detection 177 Kit (BioGerm, Shanghai, China) for groups A and B, 2019-nCoV 178 Detection Kit (Sansure, Hunan, China) for group C, 2019-nCoV 179 Detection Kit (BGI, Shenzhen, China) for group D. All of them were 180 approved by NMPA and certified by European Union CE certification. 181The parameters of the kits are shown inTable 1. The qRT-PCR tests 182were performed in parallel with the RT-RAA kit at the cooperative sites 183where the samples were provided.

FIGREF4.text: experimental operation and biosafety protection in this study 188 strictly abide by SARS-CoV-2 Laboratory Biosafety Guidelines (second 189 Edition) [10] and Technical Guide for Laboratory testing of COVID-19 190 (fourth Edition) [11] issued by the General office of the State Health 191 Commission. 192 Statistical data analysis 193 IBM SPSS Statistics, version 21 (IBM Corporation, NY, USA) was 194 used to perform all of the statistical analysis. The results of qRT-PCR 195 assay and RT-RAA assay were analyzed using Kappa and McNemar's 196 tests, and a value of P < 0.05 was considered statistically significant. 197 Kappa stands for the measure of agreement between the two tests, and 198 that> 0.9 is excellent. Linear regression analysis was used to analyze the 199 relationship between the time threshold (min) detected by RT-RAA and 200 the cycle threshold (Ct) of qRT-PCR method. 201

FIGREF5.text: 206As shown inFig. 2, RT-RAA kit showed 100% specificity for SARS-CoV-2，no cross reaction with four common coronaviruses and 208 other viral and bacterial pathogens was observed.209 Characteristics of the samples 210 A total of 947 clinical specimens were obtained from patients with 211 suspected pneumonia and SARS-CoV-2 infection from Jan 18, 2020 to 212 Apr 1, 2020, of which 59.66% (565 /947) were male. The age range was 213 7-93 years old, with an average age of 44 ± 17.1. The types of specimens 214 included pharynx swab (834, 88.07%), sputum (82, 8.66%), 215 nasopharyngeal swab (16, 1.69%), nasal swab (8, 0.84%), 216 bronchoalveolar lavage fluid (4, 0.42%), stool (2, 0.21%), whole blood 217 (1, 0.11%). The Ct values of qRT-PCR positive samples ranged from 218 8.59 to 39.07. 219

FIGREF6.text: ). Among the 947 samples, RT-RAA results of 222 926 samples were consistent with qRT-PCR (330 were positive, 596 223 were negative) and 21 samples (1 sputum and 20 pharynx swabs) were 224 inconsistent. The total coincidence rate between RT-RAA and qRT-PCR 225 was 100% in both group A and B. The Ct value of positive samples was 226 in the range of 17.00 to 37.00 in group A and 20.50 to 36.50 in group B. 227 In group C, 6 samples had inconsistent results. Among them, 2 samples 228 with Ct value of 38.00 were positive by qRT-PCR but missed by RT-RAA, the remaining 4 samples were negative by qRT-PCR but 230 positive by RT-RAA. In group D, 15 samples had discordant results 231 including 6 samples positive by qRT-PCR but missed by RT-RAA and 232 the Ct values of these samples were 38.33, 38.22, 39.07, 36.89, 37.56 233 and 38.16, respectively. The remaining 9 samples were negative by 234 qRT-PCR but positive by RT-RAA. Positive rates of RT-RAA and 235 qRT-PCR in different sample types are shown in

FIGREF7.text: The time distribution of RT-RAA positive samples 247 We showed the time distribution of partial RT-RAA positive samples (90 248 samples from group A, B and C, Fig. 3) to explore the quantitative 249 possibility of RT-RAA. The correlation between the time threshold (TT) 250 (min) detected by RT-RAA and the cycle threshold (Ct) values of 251 qRT-PCR method was weak with a coefficient R squared value of 0.303. 252 The regression equation was Y = 0.08821*X -2.005 (gradient ： 253 0.08821, 95% CI : 0.06465 to 0.1634; intercept: -2.005, 95% CI : -2.841 254 to -1.170 , P <0.0001) 255 As shown in Fig 3, the time of most samples to reach the threshold 256 was within 3minutes, plus the pre-reaction of 7minutes, thus 10minutes 257 warranted the positivity of most samples. As most of the samples with 258 low viral load (Ct ≥ 35) had higher TT values, we prolonged and set up 259 the detection time to 8minutes to ascertain no occurrence of 260 false-negatives, making the duration of total process within 15minutes. 261Discussion262The manifestations of SARS-CoV-2 infection are highly non-specific, 263including respiratory symptoms, fever, cough, dyspnea and viral pneumonia[12].A large number of qRT-PCR methods have been 265 developed for specifically detecting SARS-CoV-2 [13-15], but they are 266 not well suitable in the community. Point-of-care testing (POCT) is 267 undoubtedly the most powerful detection in this regard, but the main 268 obstacle of POCT is the relatively low throughput hence not ideal for 269 rapid screening [16]. Isothermal nucleic acid amplifications, such as 270 NASBA, LAMP [17, 18] and CRISPR's Sherlock technology [19, 20], 271 are good alternatives to qRT-PCR, these methods showed comparable 272 sensitivity and specificity to qRT-PCR in the detection of SARS-CoV-2 273 and relatively easier operation and shorter turn-around time, however, 274 these reports only included limited clinical samples and data, the 275 feasibility of these methods need to be further verified. In this study, we 276 conduct a multicenter clinical evaluation of RT-RAA kit for 277 SARS-CoV-2 using about 1000 samples. We also include respiratory 278 tract samples (throat swabs, sputum, nasopharyngeal swabs, nasal swabs, 279 bronchoalveolar lavage fluid) and non-respiratory samples (stool and 280 whole blood), which makes our results more reliable and adaptable. 281The most attractive feature of RAA kit is the ultra-fast speed of 282 detection, making this kit ideal for rapid preliminary screening in 283 clinical settings, particularly for applications in resource-poor settings. 284The detection results could be achieved in 8-15 minutes after addition of 285 extracted nucleic acid. Actually, the time for vast majority of positive 286 samples (corresponding Ct values ranged from 17.00-37.00) was within 28710minutes. As RT-RAA is able to test 16 sample per run, in practice, one 288 person is able to finish 16 samples in 40minutes by working with 289 automatic DNA extraction. In addition, the RAA device is a portable 290 equipment and easy to use. Moreover, the RT-RAA kits containing the 291 lyophilized reaction pellets are very convenient for transport because 292 lyophilized reagents are stable at room temperature. Like qRT-PCR kits, 293 the single-tube design of RT-RAA also reduces the possibility of 294

FIGREF8.text: RNA template. A total of 21 inconsistent samples either had high Ct 298 values (positive only by qRT-PCR) or higher TT value (positive only 299 by RT-RAA), highlighting the importance of cautious consideration of 300 these positives. This discrepancy between two methods was not 301 dissolved by repetitive experiments because of the heavy work burden 302 during the outbreak in the institutions. The failure (potential false 303 negative and false positive) of RT-RAA kit might be due to either the 304 viral load is lower than the detection limit or operation errors or the 305 difference in the sensitivity and specificity of different qRT-PCR kits 306 used. Despite this inconsistence, compared with the commercial 307 qRT-PCR kits, the total coincidence rate was 97.78% (926/947, 95% CI: 96.80 to 98.70), the Kappa value was 0.952 (P < 0.05), indicating the 309 overall clinical performance of RT-RAA kit is comparable to those 310 approved qRT-PCR kits. 311 Nevertheless, this study has a few limitations. The internal control is 312 not included in the kit, not monitoring the occurrence of false-negatives. 313 Additionally, only single gene (ORF1ab) is targeted thus the specificity 314 or sensitivity might be compromised. The nucleic acid extraction step is 315 not yet integrated in the RAA device thus hinders its portability of field 316 detection. Further improvements to this RT-RAA kit are under way in 317 this regard. 318

FIGREF10.text: Sensitivity of RT-RAA assays for SARS-CoV-2. 425Fig. 2 Specificity of RT-RAA assays for SARS-CoV-2. 426 Human coronavirus (CoV-229E, OC43, HKU1, NL63), human 427 rhinovirus (HRV), Boca virus (HBoV), parainfluenza virus (PIV), 428 respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), human metapneumovirus (HMPV), 429 and chlamydia pneumoniae (CP), Influenza A virus (Flu A), 430 streptococcus pneumoniae (SP) and Klebsiella pneumoniae (KPN) 431 Fig. 3 Linear regression analysis of RT-RAA threshold time (TT) (Y 432 axis) and qRT-PCR cycle threshold values (Ct) (X axis) were 433 determined by SPSS 21.

TABREF0.text: inconsistent. The sensitivity and specificity of RT-RAA was 97.63% 55 [330/338, 95% confidence interval (CI): 95.21 to 98.90] and 97.87% 56 (596/609, 95% CI: 96.28 to 98.81), respectively. The positive predictive 57 value (PPV) and negative predictive value (NPV) were 96.21% (330/343, 58 95% CI: 93.45 to 97.88), and 98.68% (596/604, 95% CI: 97.30 to 99.38), 59 respectively. The total coincidence rate was 97.78% (926/947, 95% CI: 60 96.80 to 98.70) and the Kappa was 0.952 (P <0.05).61 In December 2019, a pneumonia outbreak associated with a novel 69 coronavirus occurred in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China [1]. This 70 At present, there is no effective treatment for COVID-19. The key to 74 prevention and control lies in early diagnosis, early treatment and early 75 isolation of patients. Therefore, rapid and accurate diagnosis of 76 SARS-CoV-2 infection is very important to cut off the transmission 77 chain. Virus isolation and culture is the gold standard of SARS-CoV-2 78 detection, but it is time-consuming and is limited to experimental 79 conditions. Nucleic acid test is not only a vital tool for the diagnosis and 80 differential diagnosis of SARS-CoV-2, but also a basis for judging the 81 curative effect. Fluorescence quantitative RT-PCR (qRT-PCR) is the 82 most widely used detection method of SARS-CoV-2 RNA. However, 83 faster and simpler molecular detection assays are highly needed in 84 resources-limited areas where the professional personnel and PCR 85 cyclers are lacking. For example, in the community fever clinics, a large 86 number of patients with fever need to be identified or rule out in a timely 87 manner to prevent the potential cross-infection in the crowded clinics. 88 Compared with qRT-PCR, recombinase-aided amplification 89 (RAA)-based assay is faster and simpler and the result can be obtained 90 under a constant temperature with portable instruments within 30min. Briefly, the principle of RAA is to use a recombinase binding tightly to 92 the primer to form a complex of the enzyme and the primer. When the 93 primer searches for a sequence completely complementary to the 94 template DNA, strand replacement occurs between the primers and the 95 template with the single-stranded DNA binding (SSB). In the presence 96 of DNA polymerase, the new DNA fragment could be amplified rapidly 97 in vitro. A specific fluorescent probe is added to the amplification 98 system to realize RAA real-time monitoring. RAA has been successfully 99
